column2: vegasvictim, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I also had a cysto with biopsy and was given 7 day course to prevent UTI. I took day after surgery with mild nausea. Second day I felt like I was coming down with the flu. #rd day in bed most of the day, chills, sweating, dizziness, weakness in left leg. Intense pain started in left big toe joint, and moved to include ankle. Kept me awake all night, along with violent vomiting. No fever, so I thought I may have food poisoning or blood clot. Belly pains started same night and pulse was fast. My tongue felt slightly swollen 2nd day, but went away and came back next day. Scary scary stuff! I hope none of this is permanent or liver involved. My doctor's office said stop it immediately and called in Bactrim. I have shoulder, foot and ankle pain still. Nausea better....10 hours since last dose. BE CAREFUL with this medication and know these supposedly very rare side effects!! I somehow think they may not be as rare as maker claims. I will NEVER take this medication again. I thought I may of had a mild stroke or was getting a blood clot with the foot/ankle pain. I will ask doctor for blood tests on Wednesday follow-up visit to make sure my liver wasn't damaged. ALSO--we need to all call the FDA and report these side effects so they know how bad and common they are. Good luck everyone & God Bless.

column9: I am deathly allergic to sulfa drugs and this is in all my medical info. The nurse asked if I could take Macrobid. I said as long as its not sulfa or Macrodantin, I'll try it. column2: Patti M, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am sitting here and can't believe what I have just read.  I now have something similar to pneumonia brought on by consuming macro dantin for 1 1/2 yrs also.  I can barely breath, talk or have any energy.  The woman dying in ICU is so sad.  I am almost there myself.  I have a gall bladder stone operation scheduled for Monday and my lungs aren't really ready.  I have 88% oxygen and must exercise them.  I guess the pneumonia like systems are worse than the real thing.  It's a glue like substance that's in my lungs.  I was hospitalized for 3 days this week and the ER doctor figured it out.  The pulmonary doctor and surgeon all agreed.  Why isn't this documented?  And, why did my "wonderful" urologists not warn me of this?  My family and I are stunned.  I could be that woman dying in the ICU.  I sound awful and my breathing is labored.  Is it because I drink so much water that I am not at the point of dying like this woman?  My mother said I should participate in a "class action suit".  I totally agree.  I was not warned and I should have been taken off this drug and perhaps put on another one for my recurring UTI's and bladder operations.  I also have osteo arthritis - got to wonder if this was aggravated by this drug as well.  I am in a lot of arthritis pain and now on Naproxen 1000 mg a day.  I wish I didn't have to take any pills .

column2: Older, hopefullly wiser, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I received this drug for a possible bladder infection.  After 2 pills I was chilling, shaking uncontrolably, temp over 101.  Too sick to take pills the next day and recovered overnight, but not blaming the drug at that point, I took a 3rd pill with lunch.  Two hours later I was shaking and chilling again with temp over 102.  Vomitting was intermittent.  In the ER for 6 hours for rehydration, medicine to prevent infection, and another to stop the vomitting.  Two days later and hopefully wiser, my primary care physicial told me that I was having an allergic reaction to this drug and that the culture of my urine did not show an infection.  I am still recovering 2 weeks later.

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I had taken Macrodantin because I was having a cystoscopy. I took 1 pill one hour prior to the cystoscopy (9am) and 1 pill 12 hours later (10pm). At 6 pm that evening I started to have joint pain in my knees and ankles. As the night moved along it got worse and the joint pain was traveling up to my back and shoulders. I thought I was coming down with the flu. I took some tylenol to try to relieve the symptoms but the pain was getting worse. I had not been able to sleep either because of the pain and the chills . At 12:30 the diarreha started. Then severe chills, fever and vomitting. My husband placed a call to the urologist that performed the cystoscopy and was told to get to the ER. I vomitted several times in the car enroute and while in the ER. I had severe pain in my body and was shaking uncontrollably and the fever was climbing. In the ER my stats showed my blood pressure has decreased to an unacceptable number (50) and my heart rate was way too high. I received  morphine and a drug to stop the vomitting. I was told I was having a severe allergic reaction to the macrodantin. The ER admitted me as a patient and I spent several days in the hospital. I don't know how this drug has remained on the market and how often it is prescribed. I hope others can learn from this including doctors.

column2: lec, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been researching another medication and now I am scared spitless to take it (fosamax).  Just to compare the process of reviews and how it could help me, I checked macrodantin, a med I have taken daily for over 20 years.  My experience has only been positive.  One pill daily has prevented the near-constant UTI's I have had since I became sexually active at age 20.  My doctors, through the years, tried all kinds of different treatments - taking a certain med only when I had sex, drinking cranberry juice (old school), etc.  Finally, at least 20 years ago, my obgyn put me on generic macrodantin and I have been virtually UTI free for all these years.  I have had no side effects.  Though, I have had knee replacement and hip replacement, I have no idea if they are related.???  I chalk that up to arthritis.  If I were stranded on a desert island, I would want this medicine with me.  I don't know if my experience is typical or not, just know it's been a good fit for me.

column2: captainjoan, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: (Two 911 calls from allergic reaction.) Prescription for Macrodantin from MD. That day High fever 103, severe chills, pain all over, rapid heart beat, vomiting, severe pain in stomach and right side. Drove Mom to ER and was told to continue taking Macrodantin & sent home.  Later that night called 911  EMT's thought heart was the problem in ER said nothing they could do until they took vitals and admitted Mom 6 days found nothing (all test ran good) Mom was unable to walk and had severe pain in right leg.  Took one Macrodantin and Chills, Fever 101, Pain called MD that prescribed Macrodantin and I was told that not Macrodantin and to take mom to hospital again had to call 911 Mom got so bad.  Again EMT's thought it was heart and not Macrodantin (antibiotics) do not cause the fever, chills, pain, vomiting).  Doctors in ER said not the Macrodantin.  Again admitted Mom and we asked for a Specialist and the next morning got an Internist and told him about this drug and he went and LOOKED IT UP and said it could absolutely be Macrodantin.  Within 24 hours Mom was feeling better  and every day since has been improving.  Started walking again slowly.  During first trip to ER getting mom into ambulance the EMT's broke a rib on the left which was complicating issues with severe pain Mom had in abdomine.

column9: Six years ago I used this drug and now do not have a colon.  I have been through a horrible ordeal and it has changed my life forever. I am sure that this drug is fine for some people, however I do not believe that it is worth the risk that go along with it.  I developed pseudomembranous colitis, which is uncurable and in my case resulted in the removal of my colon.  I suggest not taking this drug.  And if you do I suggest taking a probiotic while you are on the medication.

column2: sf, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My mother ended up in the hospital and is still there with all of the side effects listed for this medication. She has been taking it for 5 months.  She will never take it again.  We are still waiting for test results from fluid drawn from her lungs.  Hopefully it has not damaged other organs.  Her doctor said this drug caused everything.

column2: Rachel, 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication was presribed to me "to be taken as required with food" as required ment after intercourse. I took about 5 tablets over a month with no problem, a couple of weeks ago I took one and about 8 hours later came down with an awful fever and my body was aching all over. I slept if off and in the morning I was better but had a very mild rash across my chest. A few days ago I took another one this time a fever came on about 5-6 hours later, I was feeling dizzy, my body was aching all over, I was nauseated and finally I vomited violently. I spent the whole next day in bed with fever/chills and my body aching. I am finally better today. I felt like I had been poisoned after taking this medication, please be very cautious when taking it.

column1: Urinary Tract Infection due to E. Coli Bacteria
column2: massage therapist , 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had terrible flu like symptoms, projectile vomiting, and a severe hives. The worst kidney and abdominal pain. I will never reccomend this drug to any one.

column1: Urinary Tract Infection due to E. Coli Bacteria
column2: jhahn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a very bad reaction to this drug.  It made me very ill, kidney pain, nausea, severe flu like symptoms  (chills/fever) after 4 capsules. My physcian had me stop taking it. I took it for only 1 and a 1/2 days.
